translated: Otherwise, it is the object of nonconceptual freedom from elaborations.ğŸ”½

original: shes thob nas byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: shes thob nas byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Otherwise, having attained the knowledge of the object that is free from conceptualization and free from conceptual elaboration, one awakens to perfect buddhahood.

original: de lta bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag pa ni chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las rgya cher shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag pa ni chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las rgya cher shes par bya'o //
translated: The purity of the perfections of that kind should be understood in detail from the Dharmasangiti-sutra.

original: rang nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob cing gzhan dag pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la gnas par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: rang nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob cing gzhan dag pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la gnas par mdzad pas na /
translated: Having attained the ten perfections himself and having caused others to abide in the ten perfections,

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste /
translated: he has attained the ten perfections.

original: khyad par du thob cing brnyes pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du thob cing brnyes pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ste /
translated: That which is attained and obtained is the attainment of the ten perfections.

original: thob pa pha rol tu phyin pa zhes tshig gi phrad sngon du mi 'byung ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½de la gnas nas gzhan dag pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: thob pa pha rol tu phyin pa zhes tshig gi phrad sngon du mi 'byung ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de la gnas nas gzhan dag pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rdzogs par mdzad pas na /
translated: The non-occurrence of the verbal prefix in attained perfection is due to impermanence.ğŸ”½Having abided in that, he has caused others to complete the ten perfections,

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas /
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas /
translated: therefore he abides in the ten perfections.

original: zhes bya'o // pha rol phyin bcu'i dag pa ni ji skad du gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // pha rol phyin bcu'i dag pa ni ji skad du gsungs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas so //
translated: The purity of the ten perfections is the attainment of the nature of purity as described.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gnyi gas 'dren cing ston pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gnyi gas 'dren cing ston pa gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of the ten perfections is that which is taught and explained by both the conventional and ultimate methods.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul gyi gzhung lugs gang la mnga' ba ni pha rol phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul gyi gzhung lugs gang la mnga' ba ni pha rol phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //
translated: Or, the method of the ten perfections is that which possesses the scriptural tradition of the method of the ten perfections.

original: mgon pos bcu'i dbang phyug ste //ğŸ”½sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
analyzed: mgon pos bcu'i dbang phyug ste // sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
translated: The Lord is the master of the ten.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is the one who abides in the ten stages.

original: de yang sa dang po ni don che ba 'dris pa ma yin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems pa'i sems thob pas dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sa dang po ni don che ba 'dris pa ma yin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems pa'i sems thob pas dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the first stage is called the Joyful because of the joy and supreme joy of attaining the supramundane mind that is not familiar with the great meaning.

original: sa gnyis pa ni ltung ba phra mo dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad bral pa nyid kyi phyir dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni ltung ba phra mo dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad bral pa nyid kyi phyir dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The second level is called the Immaculate because it is free from all stains of moral downfall and of the transgression of moral discipline.

original: sa gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang thos pa'i gzungs nges shes pa'i snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang thos pa'i gzungs nges shes pa'i snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The third level is called the Radiant because it is the basis of the infinite light of the retention of concentration and retention of what is heard, and of the light of gnosis.

original: sa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsreg pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa de ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'phro bar gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½sa lnga pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bud shing bsreg pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa de ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'phro bar gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o // sa lnga pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: The fourth level is called the Radiant because the fire of the wisdom of the cultivation of the elements leading to enlightenment burns the firewood of the defilements, and the light of the fire of wisdom spreads.

original: chos de dag nyid thobs kyi sgom pa de la dbang bya bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid thobs kyi sgom pa de la dbang bya bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The fifth level is called Hard to Conquer because it is difficult to conquer the attainment of the elements leading to enlightenment and the cultivation of those elements.ğŸ”½The sixth level is called the Manifest because the perfection of wisdom manifests on it.

original: sa drug pa ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la lan mang du yid la byed pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad par ring du rjes su zhugs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sa dang @176b rjes su 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa drug pa ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la lan mang du yid la byed pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o // sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad par ring du rjes su zhugs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sa dang @176b rjes su 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The sixth stage is called the Manifest because the engagement of the formative forces becomes manifest and the attention directed to the absence of causal signs becomes manifest.ğŸ”½The seventh stage is called the Far-reaching because the attention directed to the absence of causal signs is uninterrupted and continuous for a long time and because it is connected with the stage of purification.

original: sa brgyad pa ni mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir mi g-yob zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir mi g-yob zhes bya'o //
translated: The eighth stage is called the Unshakable because it is spontaneous with regard to the absence of causal signs and because it is unshaken by the manifestation of the addictions associated with causal signs.

original: sa dgu ba ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na ma thob med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dgu ba ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na ma thob med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: The ninth level is called the one of Excellent Wisdom because one has attained the vast wisdom that is free from any moral fault in teaching the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: sa bcu pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi sku sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi sku sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: The tenth level is called the one of the Cloud of Dharma because the great cloud of the Dharma covers and pervades the space-like body that is the basis of negative reflex actions.

original: sa bcu gcig pa ni nyon mongs pa dang zhes sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnams pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa ni nyon mongs pa dang zhes sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnams pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eleventh level is called the Buddha level because one has completely and perfectly awakened to all aspects of the knowable without attachment and obstruction, having eliminated the most subtle obscurations of afflictive and non-afflictive factors.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun du rmongs pa ni du mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun du rmongs pa ni du mchis /
translated: How many kinds of delusion are there, O Blessed One?

original: gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni du mchis lags /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni du mchis lags /
translated: How many kinds of antidotes to negative reflex actions are there?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig ste /
translated: Avalokitavrata explains that the twenty-two confusions are the eleven factors that are the antidotes to the negative tendencies.

original: sa dang po la ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa kun du rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pas kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sa dang po la ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa kun du rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pas kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the first ground, there is the confusion of clinging to the true existence of persons and phenomena, the confusion of the afflictions of the lower realms, and the negative tendencies of those.

original: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the second ground, there is the confusion of error regarding subtle downfalls, the confusion of the various types of karma, and the negative tendencies of those.

original: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i chags kyi kun du rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i chags kyi kun du rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the third ground, there is the confusion of attachment to the desire realm, the confusion of not perfecting the retention of what one has heard, and the negative tendencies of those.

original: bzhi ba la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //ğŸ”½lnga pa la ni 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun du rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun du rmongs pa dang /

translated: On the fourth, there is the confusion of craving meditative absorption and the confusion of craving the Dharma, and the counteragent to the negativity of that.

original: de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the fifth, there is the confusion of attention that is exclusively averse to and exclusively attracted to cyclic existence, and the confusion of attention that is exclusively averse to and exclusively attracted to nirvana, and the counteragent to the negativity of that.

original: drug pa la ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon du bya ba @177a * //
analyzed: drug pa la ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon du bya ba @177a * //

translated: On the seventh, the confusion of the appearance of subtle signs and the confusion of the method of attending to signlessness, and their resistances.

original: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la stsol ba kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma rnams la mi dbang ba kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //

translated: It is to know how to teach the Dharma to each and every one, to know how to not transgress the assemblies, to know the various types of vessels as they are, to know how to teach the Dharma so that it bears fruit, and to know how to teach the Dharma without interruption or omission.ğŸ”½Thus, since he is the master of words, he is the master of words.

original: de ltar tshig rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas na tshig bdag go / de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi skad la 'jug pa shes pa ste /

translated: Among them, the correct understanding of language is to know how to engage in the language of all sentient beings.

original: lha'i skad dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i skad la 'jug pa shes pa ste /

analyzed: mdor na ji snyed du 'gro ba ltar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang / tshig gi lam dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / brda dang / spyod pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rab tu shes te /

original: sgro btags pa med pa yang shes te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa med pa yang shes te /

original: de'i phyir tshig rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas na tshig la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas na tshig la dbang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the master of words, and so he has mastery over words.

analyzed: nges pa'i tshig de yang thogs pa med pa 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba nas sems can thams cad mgu par byed pa'i bar te /
translated: That verbal expression is unimpeded, nonerroneous, and so on up to it delights all sentient beings.

original: des na smra mkhas pa'o ;
analyzed: des na smra mkhas pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, he is eloquent.

original: / de la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni chags pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang / dpyad par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang / thogs pa med par lung bsgo ba bstan pa shes pa dang /

translated: Regarding that, the correct understanding of eloquence is the knowledge of the teaching of a prediction that is without attachment, the knowledge of the teaching of a prediction that is investigated, the knowledge of the teaching of a prediction that is unimpeded,

analyzed: pa'i spobs pa dang / 'bras bu yod pa'i spobs pa dang / ji ltar dris pa bzhin du spobs pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa'i spobs pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i spobs pa nas ji srid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa tshim par bya ba'i spobs pa ste / mi dor mi lkugs pa'i tshig dang / tshig mi brlang ba dang / brtan pa dang / mi rtsub pa dang / 'jam pa dang / dag pa dang / rab tu grol ba dang / thogs pa med pa dang / zur phyin pa dang / nges pa dang /
translated: the eloquence of the result, the eloquence of answering according to the question, the eloquence of the unassailable, the eloquence of the uncorrupted, up to the eloquence of satisfying the mental activity of all sentient beings by teaching the real just as it is.ğŸ”½the speech that is not to be abandoned, the speech that is not mute, the speech that is not harsh, the speech that is firm, the speech that is not rough, the speech that is gentle, the speech that is pure, the speech that is completely liberated, the speech that is unimpeded, the speech that is precise, the speech that is certain,

original: mi g-yo ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / zhi ba dang / gzung ba'i tshig dang / btsun pa'i tshig nas de bzhin du sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / zhi ba dang / gzung ba'i tshig dang / btsun pa'i tshig nas de bzhin du sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: the speech that is unwavering, the speech that is not agitated, the speech that is peaceful, the speech that is to be grasped, the speech that is venerable, up to the speech that is to be liberated in order to end suffering.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'i gsung gang mnga' ba de ni tshig mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'i gsung gang mnga' ba de ni tshig mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: His speech, which is the means of guiding disciples, is the infinite words.

original: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dbye bas tshig rnams ston pa'i dbye ba yod pas rnam grangs su byas nas bshad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dbye bas tshig rnams ston pa'i dbye ba yod pas rnam grangs su byas nas bshad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the four correct knowledges are not explained by way of enumeration, since there is a division of words that are taught.

original: yang na tshig thams cad bskyed pa'i sngags kyi bdag nyid kyis bzhugs pas na tshig rje ste /
analyzed: yang na tshig thams cad bskyed pa'i sngags kyi bdag nyid kyis bzhugs pas na tshig rje ste /
translated: Or, he is the lord of words because he exists as the essence of the mantra that generates all words.

original: gtso bo ni dbang por gyur pa yin pas rgyur gyur pa las 'bras bu'i tshul du grub pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni dbang por gyur pa yin pas rgyur gyur pa las 'bras bu'i tshul du grub pa'o //
translated: Since he is the lord, he is the cause, and since he is the principal, he is the result.

original: tshig 'byung ba rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor bas na tshig bdag go //
analyzed: tshig 'byung ba rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor bas na tshig bdag go //
translated: He is the master of words because he is applied to the uninterrupted origination of words.

original: de ltar grub pa'i tshig gi rgyun 'byung bas pha rol smra ba po ma lus par tshar gcod pas tshig gi nus pa dang ldan pa smra mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar grub pa'i tshig gi rgyun 'byung bas pha rol smra ba po ma lus par tshar gcod pas tshig gi nus pa dang ldan pa smra mkhas pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is the eloquent one who has the power of words, since he completely defeats all opponents through the origination of the stream of words that are thus established.

original: sam skri ta dang / skad tha mal pa dang / zur bcag pa dang / sha za'i skad dang / ma ga dh'a pa'i skad dang / zung du 'jug pa'i skad dang / tha dad pa la sogs pa'i skad thams cad la mkhas shing thams cad du tshig gis ston pas na tshig la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: sam skri ta dang / skad tha mal pa dang / zur bcag pa dang / sha za'i skad dang / ma ga dh'a pa'i skad dang / zung du 'jug pa'i skad dang / tha dad pa la sogs pa'i skad thams cad la mkhas shing thams cad du tshig gis ston pas na tshig la dbang ba'o //
translated: He is master of speech, for he is skilled in all languages, such as Sanskrit, the vernaculars, the dialects, the languages of the ogres, the language of Magadha, the language of the union, the language of the different groups, and so on, and he teaches in all of them.

original: de bzhin du 'khor thams cad kyis zil gyis non par mi nus kyang tshig gi rgyun la yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis len 'ga' rgyun chad par dogs pa de lta bu 'di la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor thams cad kyis zil gyis non par mi nus kyang tshig gi rgyun la yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis len 'ga' rgyun chad par dogs pa de lta bu 'di la mi mnga' ste /
translated: Similarly, he is never at a loss for words, even though his audience is so vast that it is beyond the capacity of any other to address it.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i rgyu'i khyad par byang chub sems kyi ngo bo nyid la zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i rgyu'i khyad par byang chub sems kyi ngo bo nyid la zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the special cause of this is the inexhaustibility of the essence of the spirit of enlightenment.
